title: Fortran test fails on windows because it uses bash script
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?


2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?


3. What did you do?

Run all.bat. TDM-GCC-64 is in PATH. While tests run the following test fails:

```##### ../misc/cgo/stdio

##### ../misc/cgo/life

##### ../misc/cgo/fortran
2016/03/23 14:57:19 Failed: fork/exec ./test.bash: %1 is not a valid Win32 application.

##### ../misc/cgo/test
PASS
scatter = 00000000006573A0
hello from C
sqrt is: 0
ok      _/c_/Users/gashiman/Documents/work/golang/misc/cgo/test 1.541s
PASS
scatter = 000000000050CEC0
hello from C
sqrt is: 0
ok      _/c_/Users/gashiman/Documents/work/golang/misc/cgo/test 1.305s
PASS
scatter = 00000000006573A0
hello from C
sqrt is: 0
ok      _/c_/Users/gashiman/Documents/work/golang/misc/cgo/test 1.292s
skipped due to earlier error

##### Testing race detector
skipped due to earlier error
skipped due to earlier error
skipped due to earlier error
skipped due to earlier error
skipped due to earlier error
2016/03/23 14:58:02 FAILED```

4. What did you expect to see?

Passed or excluded test.

5. What did you see instead?

Probably there should be a test.bat for windows.
